docs.lead_paragraph: As thousands of addicts still find ways to abuse OxyContin and similar painkillers, called abuse-deterrent formulations, some experts caution that the protections are misunderstood.

headline.main: Painkillers Resist Abuse, but Experts Still Worry
headline.print_headline: Painkillers Resist Abuse, but Experts Still Worry

docs.abstract: Drug manufacturers have been creating painkiller medications intended to resist abuse by drug addicts, but efficacy of such abuse-resistant formulations remains open to question.
docs.snippet: As thousands of addicts still find ways to abuse OxyContin and similar painkillers, called abuse-deterrent formulations, some experts caution that the protections are misunderstood.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women suffering from low libido got some hope on Thursday, when a panel of health experts said the government should approve an experimental pill intended to boost sexual desire. It is the first time a government panel has endorsed such a drug. The move surprised many experts, because the Food and Drug Administration has twice rejected the drug due to lackluster effectiveness and worrisome side effects.

headline.main: Q&A: Female Sex Pill Makes Comeback With Positive Panel Vote
headline.print_headline: Q&A: Female Sex Pill Makes Comeback With Positive Panel Vote

docs.snippet: Women suffering from low libido got some hope on Thursday, when a panel of health experts said the government should approve an experimental pill intended to boost sexual desire. It is the first time a government panel has endorsed such a drug. The...

docs.lead_paragraph: The vote on flibanserin by an advisory panel to the Food and Drug Administration follows two rejections and a campaign for the drug’s approval.

headline.main: ‘Viagra for Women’ Is Backed by an F.D.A. Panel

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration advisory committee votes to approve flibanserin, making it first drug to treat diminished sexual desire in women; action is lauded by some women's organizations as move toward sexual equality by giving women counterpart to Viagra; critics point out side effects and complain of undue industry influence.
docs.snippet: The vote on flibanserin by an advisory panel to the Food and Drug Administration follows two rejections and a campaign for the drug’s approval.

docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona abortion providers asked a federal judge Thursday to block part of a recently passed law that would require doctors to tell women they can reverse the effects of a drug-induced abortion.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Sues Arizona Over New Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Sues Arizona Over New Abortion Law

docs.snippet: Arizona abortion providers asked a federal judge Thursday to block part of a recently passed law that would require doctors to tell women they can reverse the effects of a drug-induced abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton plans to spend the summer building a case that Republicans are out of touch with the public. But many people aren't convinced she empathizes with them, either, polls suggest, in a potential early warning sign for the Democratic front-runner.

headline.main: Americans Split on Whether Clinton Cares About Their Needs
headline.print_headline: Americans Split on Whether Clinton Cares About Their Needs

docs.lead_paragraph: The forum, attended by representatives of hospitals, food producers, professional medical societies and restaurant chains, highlighted the problem of antibiotic resistance.

headline.main: White House Meeting Elicits Pledges to Reduce Antibiotic Use
headline.print_headline: Forum Elicits Vows to Reduce Antibiotic Use

docs.abstract: Obama administration hosts meeting at White House with representatives from hospitals, food producers, restaurant chains and medical societies about problem of antibiotic resistance; secures pledges to reduce use of antibiotics in food; meeting is part of administration's effort to curb overuse of antibiotics.
docs.snippet: The forum, attended by representatives of hospitals, food producers, professional medical societies and restaurant chains, highlighted the problem of antibiotic resistance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The makers of a pill intended to boost sexual desire in women will try again this week to persuade regulators that the drug warrants approval after two rejections.

headline.main: Concerns Remain for 'Viagra for Women' Twice Rejected by FDA
headline.print_headline: Concerns Remain for 'Viagra for Women' Twice Rejected by FDA

docs.snippet: The makers of a pill intended to boost sexual desire in women will try again this week to persuade regulators that the drug warrants approval after two rejections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many insurers say they are asking for higher premiums because they remain unsure about the future and what their medical costs will be.

headline.main: Seeking Rate Increases, Insurers Use Guesswork

docs.abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services data shows for the 37 states using HealthCare.gov as their exchange, insurance companies are seeking very different rate increases, some as high as 85 percent, for premiums in 2016; officials caution final rates still have yet to be set and experts warn that data is not sure predictor of prices; proposed rate increases are due to insurers uncertainty.
docs.snippet: Many insurers say they are asking for higher premiums because they remain unsure about the future and what their medical costs will be.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Bidding for licenses to produce legal cannabis resembles the jockeying by those seeking to operate casinos, as hard-pressed areas vie for a potential lifeline.

headline.main: Medical Marijuana Feeds Familiar Hopes of Renewal Around New York State
headline.print_headline: Latest Economic Lifeline Is a Leafy One

docs.abstract: New York State Health Department will grant up to five licenses to cultivate, manufacture and dispense medical marijuana; competition among bidders is fierce, especially in economically depressed areas, where the newly legal enterprise is welcomed as potential job-maker.
docs.snippet: Bidding for licenses to produce legal cannabis resembles the jockeying by those seeking to operate casinos, as hard-pressed areas vie for a potential lifeline.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

docs.lead_paragraph: Heroin users seeking help for their addiction won't be arrested if they turn over their drugs and needles to police under a unique policy launched Monday in the Massachusetts city of Gloucester.

headline.main: Police Allow Addicts to Turn in Drugs if They Seek Treatment
headline.print_headline: Police Allow Addicts to Turn in Drugs if They Seek Treatment

docs.snippet: Heroin users seeking help for their addiction won't be arrested if they turn over their drugs and needles to police under a unique policy launched Monday in the Massachusetts city of Gloucester.
